11 22 though acceptable epicurus defends thee annihilation yet merely name give undergoes censure vain stupid temerarious ashamed thou beest opinion u thou declarest thy self making mention wicked man departed life thou callst poor wretched man much lost benefit temporal life inrolld punishment others deceased thou callst happy secure therein professing incommodity life benefit death deceased thou imprecatest thou wishest heavy earth ash torment world thou bearest good dead thou wishest rest bone ash remain nothing thee expected death sense pain joy nay thou thy self shalt remain dost thou lye thine head dost thou tell thy self something attends thee beyond grave yea dost thou fear death thou hast nothing fear death thou answerst menaceth thing thats evil deprives benefit life reply yea thou wilt give answer thy self sometimes death quits thee intolerable inconvenience life sure case loss good thing feared recompensed greater good wit 〈…〉 st inconvenience certainly feared delivers u
